content.text: Your baby rolls from the tummy to the back, and vice versa, on both sides (right and left).
Keeping the symmetry of the muscles and therefore the skeleton is very important! There should not be a preferred side at this age (we like to see that happen around age 2).
This is the first step toward independence for your baby. They can choose to get to places they want to go by rolling.
This stage prepares babyâ€™s body for army crawling (crawling on the belly).

If you see that your baby is having a hard time achieving this milestone by the age of 7 months, you should consult with your pediatrician or an infant development guide to learn how to help your baby. These important abilities are the foundation of their physical, sensory and emotional needs. Here are some signs your baby is doing well:

ul: Rolling from their tummy to their back on both the right and left sides.
Rolling from their back to their tummy on both the right and left sides.
Rolling is smooth, with flexibility and without any stiffness.
